# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia-repl
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, r"\s+") # Split the string into words based on whitespace.
    
    wrapped_str = ""
    curr_length = 0

    for word in words
        if curr_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n" # Add a new line when the current line would exceed the maximum width.
            curr_length = 0
        elseif curr_length != 0
            wrapped_str *= " " # Append a space if it's not the first word on this line.
            curr_length += 1
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= word # Add the current word to the string.
        curr_length += length(word)
    end

    return wrapped_str
end
```
Now you can try it out with the following example:
```julia-repl
test = "This is a test sentence for testing the wrap_string function."
wrapped = wrap_string(test, 10)
println(wrapped)
```
The output of this example should look like this:
```julia-repl
> This is a
> test
> sentence for testing the wrap_string function.
```
